first_reading.title: 1st book of Kings
first_reading.text:
[[1_R 19,9a]]At the mountain of God, Horeb, Elijah came to a cave, where he took shelter.
[[1_R 19,11]]"Go outside and stand on the mountain before the LORD; the LORD will be passing by." A strong and heavy wind was rending the mountains and crushing rocks before the LORD--but the LORD was not in the wind. After the wind there was an earthquake--but the LORD was not in the earthquake.
[[1_R 19,12]]After the earthquake there was fire--but the LORD was not in the fire. After the fire there was a tiny whispering sound.
[[1_R 19,13a]]When he heard this, Elijah hid his face in his cloak and went and stood at the entrance of the cave.

glory dwelling in our land.

[[Ps 85,11]]Kindness and truth shall meet; 
justice and peace shall kiss.
[[Ps 85,12]]Truth shall spring out of the earth,

[[Ps 85,13]]The LORD himself will give his benefits;

second_reading.title: Letter to the Romans
second_reading.text:
[[Rm 9,1]]Brothers and Sisters: I speak the truth in Christ, I do not lie; my conscience joins with the holy Spirit in bearing me witness
[[Rm 9,2]]that I have great sorrow and constant anguish in my heart.
[[Rm 9,3]]For I could wish that I myself were accursed and separated from Christ for the sake of my brothers, my kin according to the flesh.
[[Rm 9,4]]They are Israelites; theirs the adoption, the glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the worship, and the promises;
[[Rm 9,5]]theirs the patriarchs, and from them, according to the flesh, is the Messiah. God who is over all be blessed forever. Amen.

gospel.text:
[[Mt 14,22]]After he had fed the people, Jesus made the disciples get into the boat and precede him to the other side of the sea, while he dismissed the crowds.
[[Mt 14,23]]After doing so, he went up on the mountain by himself to pray. When it was evening he was there alone.
[[Mt 14,24]]Meanwhile the boat, already a few miles offshore, was being tossed about by the waves, for the wind was against it.
[[Mt 14,25]]During the fourth watch of the night, he came toward them, walking on the sea.
[[Mt 14,26]]When the disciples saw him walking on the sea they were terrified. "It is a ghost," they said, and they cried out in fear.
[[Mt 14,27]]At once (Jesus) spoke to them, "Take courage, it is I; do not be afraid."
[[Mt 14,28]]Peter said to him in reply, "Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the water."
[[Mt 14,29]]He said, "Come." Peter got out of the boat and began to walk on the water toward Jesus.
[[Mt 14,30]]But when he saw how (strong) the wind was he became frightened; and, beginning to sink, he cried out, "Lord, save me!"
[[Mt 14,31]]Immediately Jesus stretched out his hand and caught him, and said to him, "O you of little faith, why did you doubt?"
[[Mt 14,32]]After they got into the boat, the wind died down.
[[Mt 14,33]]Those who were in the boat did him homage, saying, "Truly, you are the Son of God."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
